content:
Hello folks,

I am pleased to announce a new online seminar series: the Bohemian Logical & Philosophical Café.

The BLPC is a framework for webinars on current topics in a variety of areas,
including theoretical computer science, category theory, mathematical logic, and philosophy.

We will start the 26th of January at 16.00 Prague time (GMT+1) with our first speaker:

Michael Makkai
Notions of identity for and in higher dimensional categories.

Further speakers will include: Benno van den Berg, Jouko Väänänen, Jiří Rosický, Jeremy Avigad, André Joyal, and Mike Shulman.
Please check our webpage periodically for an updated list of speakers:

https://bohemianlpc.github.io

If you want stay updated with our calendar and you are too lazy to refresh the webpage, just join our Google Group to receive a periodical reminder of our events!

    https://groups.google.com/g/bohemianlpc

With best wishes for the New Year,

Ivan
(for the organizers)
@Ivan Di Liberti Is the youtube link still <u><a href="">youtube channel</a></u>, or is it my browser?
I think the proper links have not been added yet (the links for both Zoom and YouTube are currently blank).

Nathanael Arkor said:

I think the proper links have not been added yet (the links for both Zoom and YouTube are currently blank).

That's correct, these details of the webpage are still under construction.
Arf, I made a duplicate post about this in #general: events - shouldn't this post be moved there instead?
Maybe it'd be worth having a #general: announcements stream for this sort of thing.
@Ivan Di Liberti: is there a calendar feed for the seminar? That way, the seminar could be added to the public CT seminars calendar.

Nathanael Arkor said:

Ivan Di Liberti: is there a calendar feed for the seminar? That way, the seminar could be added to the public CT seminars calendar.

Uhm, I just created a google group in order to have a mailing list. At the moment there is no calendar feed, but give me a couple of days and there will be. :)
